Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge correctly applied the residency requirement under the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Mr. Gunnarsson was absent from Canada for 1231 days and present for 229 days in the four years preceding his application; he did not centralize his life in Canada
Court_Ruling: The Citizenship Judge's decision was reasonable and aligned with the applicable legal standards
Defendant_Behavior: Extended absences from Canada, minimal physical presence
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to meet three-year physical presence requirement in Canada
Legal_Standard: Applicant must 'regularly, ordinarily, or customarily live' in Canada
Assessment_Factor: Reasons for absence, frequency of visits, familial and economic ties to Canada
Procedural_Issue: Interpretation and application of residency rules by Citizenship Judge
Evidence_Used: Duration of presence/absence in Canada, connections to Canada
Legal_Provision_Cited: Residency requirement within four years preceding application
Application_Basis: Physical presence and centralization of life in Canada
Evidence_Assessed: Days spent in Canada (229), days absent (1231), personal and professional ties
Governing_Rule: Must accumulate three years (1095 days) of residence in Canada during the four years before application
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient proof of centralized life in Canada
Outcome: Mr. Gunnarsson remains ineligible for citizenship
Cause_Description: Mr. Gunnarsson's citizenship application was rejected due to failure to meet residency requirements
Evidence_Handling: Court reviewed time logs and personal connections to assess residency
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section of Citizenship Act regarding residency obligation
Evidence_Assessment: Weight given to duration of stay and life centralization in Canada
Decision_Rationale: Applicant did not regularly, ordinarily, or customarily reside in Canada
Decision_Making_Body: Citizenship Judge, reviewed by Federal Court
Legal_Standard_Applied: Whether the applicant 'regularly, ordinarily, or customarily lives' in Canada
